intro: Leptis, commonly known as the common leptis, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, often aromatic leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a feature common in the carrot family. Leptis species are often found in dry, rocky soils and are adapted to arid environments. They are sometimes used in traditional medicine due to their potential medicinal properties.
